CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper March 20, 1971, pg. 7, reads: "Everybody in the Fourth Grade at Manchester School worked on spring scene murals like this one during March, the season that comes in like a lion and goes out like a lamb.  Some 60 students created several such paintings in the art class of Mrs. Carol Ann McGurk.  Seen here are Lynette Hewett, Richard Street, John Caldwell and Darrell Williams. (Harris Photo)"
TitMainTitle: Teacher Carol Ann McGurk supervising fourth grade students Lynette Hewett, Richard Street, John Caldwell, and Darrell Williams paint mural with lion in Manchester School
